Tenders were not again called for by advertisement, but I am in a position to' state that the sum demanded per by the tenderer was made known, and others 'were invited, not in the usual way, but by telegram, to undertake the service at a lower price. The date on which the first tender was lodged was 4th September, 1907, and that on which the second was received was n t h December, 1907. The matter was referred to the Inspector for the district, and he recommended that the tender submitted in the proper form should be accepted. Whilst the Department did the right thing in re-advertising for tenders when it was considered that the first offer was too high, it did the wrong thing on the second occasion in, practically divulging by telegram the offer made, and asking - others to tender for a less sum.
